player_0_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: cooperation and defection.
- if both players choose cooperation, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose defection, both get 2 points.
- if you choose cooperation and the other player chooses defection, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose defection and the other player chooses cooperation, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.

options:
[move] (Choosing cooperation to establish trust and mutual benefit. Mutual cooperation yields the highest reward.) cooperation


[move] (First round against a new player; defection avoids worst-case outcome and exploits potential cooperation) defection


[move] (In a one-time game with no prior trust, defection minimizes risk of exploitation) Defection

[move] (After mutual defection, continuing to defect ensures a safe 2 points and tests opponent's strategy) defection


[move] (After mutual defection in the first round, maintaining defection avoids exploitation and secures a stable outcome) defection


[move] (After mutual defection last round, continuing to defect avoids risk and may exploit if they switch to cooperation) defection

[move] (After opponent cooperated despite my prior defection, reciprocating cooperation may encourage mutual trust for higher long-term gains) cooperation


[move] (Testing reciprocity after opponent's unexpected cooperation; cooperating to encourage mutual gains) cooperation


[move] (Opponent switched to cooperation after defection; reciprocating cooperation may encourage mutual gains) cooperation

[move] (Opponent defected after my cooperation; defecting to prevent exploitation and secure minimum 2 points) defection


[move] (Opponent defected after my cooperation; prioritizing self-protection to avoid exploitation) defection


[move] (Opponent defected after my cooperation; reverting to defection to prevent exploitation) defection

[move] (Opponent's inconsistent responses suggest exploiting their cooperation when possible) defection
